item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "No young lady can be justified in falling in love before the gentleman's love is declared, it must be very improper that a young lady should dream of a gentleman before the gentleman is first known to have dreamt of her." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Friendship is certainly the finest balm for the pangs of disappointed love." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The advantages of natural folly in a beautiful girl have been already set forth by the capital pen of a sister author; and to her treatment of the subject I will only add, in justice to men, that though to the larger and more trifling part of the sex, imbecility in females is a great enhancement of their personal charms, there is a portion of them too reasonable and too well informed themselves to desire anything more in woman than ignorance." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "Miss Morland, no one can think more highly of the understanding of women than I do. In my opinion, nature has given them so much, that they never find it necessary to use more than half." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "But your mind is warped by an innate principle of general integrity, and, therefore, not accessible to the cool reasonings of family partiality, or a desire of revenge." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "There didn't seem to her any harm in it, and the make-believe was so comforting." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "Lately you are brooding too much about rights. Give up this dangerous habit." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "Hahnji, mister, you must be patient. Before you can name that corner, our future must become past." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "He who spits paan at the ceiling only blinds himself." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "After all, our lives are but a sequence of accidents - a clanking chain of chance events. A string of choices, casual or deliberate, which add up to that one big calamity we call life." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "The Law is a grim, unsmiling thing. Not Justice, though. Justice is witty and whimsical and kind and caring." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "What sense did the world make? Where was God, the Bloody Fool? Did He have no notion of fair and unfair? Couldn't He read a simple balance sheet? He would have been sacked long ago if He were managing a corporation, the things he allowed to happen..." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Rohinton Mistry
item.description: "If there was an abundance of misery in the world, there was also sufficient joy, yes - as long as one knew where to look for it." -- Rohinton Mistry

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "There was nothing between the man and me - - nothing, not even liking. But because of the memory of some wholeness, or the hope of some regeneration, I would have dropped whatever I'd planned, just to go back to scratching around on his bed." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "...Though it seemed trivial, now, to describe a place as if what is was, was what I could see of it." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "I did believe, from my experience of life and of looking at the world, that men hated women." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "Lovers are allowed to be as cruel as anything to the one who dissappoints them." -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "What makes a woman into a doormat? What makes her see some quite ordinary other person as a looming Goliath? And are not these relationships such an outrage to reality that they cannot last a lifetime?" -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "Do the thing that's less passive. Do the active thing. There's more of the human in that. " -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "Did anyone ever hear of an intelligent fantasy?" -- Nuala O'Faolain

item.title: Amanda add a quote by Nuala O'Faolain
item.description: "The world is wonderful, she said. All its little things. It is wonderful." -- Nuala O'Faolain
